text: my name is don mccaskill i'm the ceo and
chief geek at smugmug smugmug is a
premium online photo and video sharing
service we have millions of passionate
customers and we store billions of their
photos and videos smug mug was growing
very fast but had a tiny team we didn't
have venture capital or a large amount
of cash to invest in data centers and
storage we needed somewhere to store all
of these millions of photos and videos
that our customers were uploading
in a accessible
available durable way and aws came along
with what seemed like a magic solution
our customers trust us to keep their
photos and videos safe and sound and we
had been following industry best
practices storing multiple copies in
multiple geographic locations but we
never imagined that anyone could achieve
eleven nines we were overjoyed this was
a great way for us to ensure that none
of our customers would lose any of their
priceless memories when smugmug first
started using aws we used s3 primarily
for storage at first it was just backup
storage for our own local data center
storage but we quickly discovered that
the durability and availability was so
much higher than our own that it made
sense to just use it as primary storage
as soon as we started storing everything
up there we realized it made a lot of
sense to do all of our compute around
the photos in ec2 rather than s3 people
are uploading right after a vacation a
lot and we need to be able to scale up
right after christmas or new year's to
handle that load so that was a big deal
we realized that we would get a much
faster performance and lower latency if
we moved our actual photo serving
infrastructure into ec2 so the next
service that we moved up there was a
specialized on-the-fly rendering service
for some of our larger customers to do
very specialized displays of their smug
mug photos all of our customers that are
uploading photos every second of every
day they're actually uploading them
straight into aws which handles all of
the details around processing uploads
and cueing them we now use cloud search
as our search engine for finding people
who use smugmug for finding galleries
and sets of photos and of course finding
individual photos and being able to
efficiently search for a specific trip
your family took a few years back very
rapidly and very precisely turned out to
be a huge win for us to offload to aws
because quite frankly aws understands
search a lot better than we do
we are migrating all of our services out
of our data centers and into aws within
the next few months our customers expect
their web pages and photos to load
lightning fast and their uploads to
process very rapidly and so the addition
of ssd backed ec2 instances and this
amazing nosql
datastore dynamodb finally makes it
possible for us to move all of our
database backed
operations and services
fully into aws instead of maintaining
them in our current data centers as
we've been doing
aws has meant that we're able to move
much more quickly and react to customer
feedback much more responsibly than we
ever have been
our operations team isn't spending all
their time
physically moving equipment into and out
of data centers they're they're spending
their time instrumenting
and operating on aws apis which is
massively more efficient we are able to
achieve economies of scale that exceed a
million visitors per engineer we
wouldn't be able to build
those same services in-house it's just
really amazing to know that you have
some of the world's best
engineers and ops people working night
and day at aws on your behalf
